Ironi Trotoar Diperlebar, tapi Pejalan Kaki Tergusur Parkir Liar
02 Nov 2019, 20:33 by Matius Alfons
Jakarta - Pemprov DKI Jakarta tengah menggencarkan program penataan sejumlah trotoar demi kenyamanan pejalan kaki. Namun kondisi ironis terjadi di trotoar Jalan Fatmawati, Cilandak, Jakarta Selatan.
Ya, trotoar di Jalan Fatmawati termasuk salah satu yang ditata dan diperlebar. Namun pelebaran trotoar justru dimanfaatkan untuk parkir liar kendaraan hingga tempat mangkalnya pedagang kaki lima (PKL).
Seperti dipantau detikcom di sepanjang Jalan Fatmawati, Jakarta Selatan, Sabtu (2/11/2019), terlihat sebagian besar badan trotoar di sepanjang jalan ini tertutup kendaraan. Selain itu, beberapa pedagang kaki lima menjajakan dagangannya di atas trotoar.
Terlihat beberapa pejalan kaki pun akhirnya terpaksa keluar dari trotoar karena terhalangi mobil, motor, hingga truk barang yang parkir liar di atas trotoar. Bahkan jalur khusus untuk penyandang disabilitas juga terhalang oleh kendaraan yang parkir di atas trotoar.
Kondisi ini diperparah oleh adanya beberapa trotoar yang juga tertutup bekas puing-puing yang rusak. Terlihat puing tersebut menghalangi lintasan untuk penyandang disabilitas.
Salah satu pejalan kaki, Hendrik (31), mengaku merasa terganggu oleh kondisi kendaraan dan beberapa PKL yang menghalangi trotoar. Dia mengaku sia-sia dengan kondisi trotoar yang diperlebar namun malah digunakan untuk parkir liar.
"Terganggunya karena trotoar umumnya untuk pejalan kaki, jadi buat apa ada trotoar banyak tapi yang nempatin mobil-mobil. Saya juga denger pemerintah lebarin trotoar. Kalau trotoar lebar-lebar tapi ujung-ujungnya yang nempatin mobil, ya buat apa," kata Hendrik.

The irony of the sidewalk is widened, but pedestrians are displaced by illegal parking
02 Nov 2019, 20:33 by Matthew Alfons
Jakarta - The Provincial Government of DKI Jakarta is intensifying a number of sidewalk structuring programs for the convenience of pedestrians. But an ironic condition occurred on the sidewalk on Jalan Fatmawati, Cilandak, South Jakarta.
Yes, the sidewalk on Fatmawati Street is one that is laid out and widened. But the widening of the sidewalk is actually used to park vehicles illegally to the pedestrian street vendors (PKL).
As monitored by AFP along Fatmawati Street, South Jakarta, Saturday (11/02/2019), it was seen that most of the sidewalk bodies along this road were covered with vehicles. In addition, some street vendors peddle their wares on the sidewalk.
It was seen that several pedestrians were finally forced out of the sidewalk because they were blocked by cars, motorbikes, and cargo trucks that parked wildly on the sidewalk. Even special lanes for people with disabilities are also blocked by vehicles parked on the sidewalk.
This condition is exacerbated by the presence of several sidewalks that are also covered in damaged debris. The debris is seen blocking the path for people with disabilities.
One of the pedestrians, Hendrik (31), admitted that he was disturbed by the condition of the vehicle and several street vendors who were blocking the sidewalk. He claimed in vain with the conditions of the sidewalks widened but instead used for illegal parking.
"It is disturbed because the sidewalks are generally for pedestrians, so why are there many sidewalks but there are cars. I also hear the government widening the sidewalks. If the sidewalks are wide but the edges are where cars are placed, what for?"
